items.name: Magic Wand
items.description: A simple wand used to channel magic energies, it is favored by apprentice wizards and great warlocks alike.

abilities.name: Energy Charge
abilities.description: Instantly heals and and replenishes the caster's health and mana per accumulated charge.
notes: Has no recharge time. Cooldown resetting effects do not restore charges.
Instead, gains a charge whenever a visible enemy casts an ability nearby.
When upgraded to Holy Locket, all the current charges are carried over.
Interrupts the wielder's channeling abilities.
Gains 1 charge for each ability cast by an enemy.
Does not gain charges from active attack modifiers, toggle-able abilities, other sources, active abilities that are procced passively, or abilities cast out of invisibility.
With multiple copies within the inventory, the oldest item gains charges first.
Can heal and mana restore up to 300 with max charges.

additionalInfo: The item's attributes grant 66 health and 0.3 health regeneration.
36 mana, 0.15 mana regeneration and 0.3% flat base magic resistance.
3 attack speed and 0.5 main armor.
3 main attack damage to all Strength/Agility/Intelligence heroes.
4.05 main attack damage to universal heroes.

items.name: Null Talisman
items.description: A small gemstone attached to several chains.
additionalInfo: The item's attributes grant the following additional stats:
44 health and 0.2 health regeneration
60 mana, 0.25 mana regeneration and 0.5% flat base magic resistance
2 attack speed and 0.33 main armor
2, 2 and 5 main attack damage to all Strength/Agility/Intelligence heroes respectively
4.05 main attack damage to universal heroes
Has 2 levels and automatically upgrades based on the in-game clock
Heroes who need an early game stat boost often benefit from Null Talisman, spell-casters can also benefit from the additional mana and mana regeneration
For intelligence heroes, a Bracer grants almost as much main attack damage as a Null Talisman

items.name: Power Treads
items.description: A pair of tough-skinned boots that change to meet the demands of the wearer.

abilities.name: Switch Attribute
abilities.description: Switches between granting strength, agility, and intelligence.
notes: Interrupts the wielder's channeling abilities upon cast
When wielding multiple Power Treads, each of them can be toggled individually. The attribute bonuses fully stack
Illusions copy the current toggle state
Does not change current health percentages
Does not change current mana percentages
Meepo Clones cannot cast this ability. However, the Clones instantly update their switched attribute whenever the Prime switches the item's attributes

additionalInfo: Movement speed bonuses from multiple pairs of Boots of Speed-based items do not stack, the one with a higher value takes priority
Stacks with all other movement speed bonus

There are three ways to assemble Power Treads. Based on which item is chosen, the boot's initial Strength / Agility / Intelligence attribute status is different. The status can be switched with Switch Attribute freely after purchase
When listed in quickbuy, the item's assembly components are based on the hero's primary attribute. For universal heroes, it shows the strength version
Disassembling Power Treads returns the items which were originally used to build it. It is not based on the currently selected attribute

states.contains: 120 mana + 0.5 mana regen + 1% magic resistance, 25 attack speed

items.name: Blade Mail
items.description: A razor-sharp coat of mail, it is the choice of selfless martyrs in combat.

abilities.name: Damage Return (Passive)
abilities.description: Any attack targeted at the wielder harms the attacker for a fixed amount, plus a percentage of the attack damage dealt.
notes: Only reacts on attack damage. Other sources of damage are ignored.
Returns incoming damage before all manipulations. However, damage manipulation on the enemy still affects the damage normally.
Reflected physical damage is affected by damage block as well.
The returned damage is always dealt right after the incoming damage.
Returned damage has the no-reflection flag, preventing its damage from interacting with other sources of damage with the same flag.
The damage has the no-spell-lifesteal flag, preventing its damage from utilising spell lifesteal.
The damage has the no-spell-amplification flag, preventing its damage from being amplified with spell damage amplification.
Returns damage back to the source. This means damage done by summons is reflected back to the summons, not to their owner.
Damage Return has a global range and affects units through the Fog of War or invisibility.
Does not work against wards, buildings and allied units.

abilities.name: Damage Return
abilities.description: For the next few seconds, a portion of all damage taken is reflected back to the source. Does not protect the wielder from the damage.
notes: Does not interrupts the caster's channeling abilities upon cast.
Increases the passive value to 105% of attack damage taken, plus the flat value.
Additionally causes Blade Mail to reflect Spell Damage as well, returning 85% of the damage taken.
Does not reflect self-inflicted damage, damage flagged as HP Removal, or damage with the No-Reflection flag.
Returns the same damage type as received.

additionalInfo: Multiple instances of Damage Return from Blade Mails do not stack.
Fully stack with other no-reflection damage sources.

items.name: Shiva's Guard
items.description: Said to have belonged to a goddess, today it retains much of its former power.

abilities.name: Arctic Blast
abilities.description: Emits an expanding freezing wave that follows and covers an area around the caster, dealing damage and slowing movement speed of enemies as it reaches them.
notes: Does not interrupt the caster's channeling abilities upon cast. Exception: Tricks of the Trade.
Arctic Blast is centered on the caster for the full duration.
The blast spreads at a speed of 400, taking 2.25 seconds to cover the whole radius.
Affects the entire area while expanding, the area of effect is not a ring.
Also weakens enemies hit by the wave, applying a debuff that amplifies any spell damage they take. The debuff is applied before the ability's damage is applied.
Shares a debuff with Magic Weakness, the last applied source overrides previous sources.
Provides 800 radius flying vision, following the caster and leaving a trail of vision which lasts for 2 seconds.

abilities.name: Freezing Aura
abilities.description: Reduces the attack speed, as well as the effectiveness of healing and health restoration of nearby enemies.
notes: Multiple instances of Freezing Aura do not stack.
Does not affects invulnerable or hidden enemies.
The status debuff icon on enemies only shows up when the affected unit has vision over the source.

additionalInfo: This item is shown as a Team Item in the shop window when purchased by an ally.

The item's attributes grant the following additional stats: 110 health and 0.5 health regeneration, 60 mana, 0.25 mana regeneration and 0.5% flat base magic resistance, 5 attack speed and 0.83 main armor, 5 main attack damage to all Strength/Agility/Intelligence heroes, 6.75 main attack damage to universal heroes.

items.name: Kaya and Sange
items.description: Two of three known items of unimaginable power that many believe were crafted at the same enchanter's forge.
additionalInfo: The item's attributes grant 352 health and 1.6 health regeneration
The item's attributes grant 192 mana, 0.8 mana regeneration and 1.6% flat base magic resistance
The item's attributes grant 16 main attack damage to Strength/Intelligence heroes
The item's attributes grant 14.4 main attack damage to universal heroes
For Kaya-based items: Multiple sources of spell damage amplification do not stack
For Kaya-based items: Multiple sources of mana regeneration amplification do not stack
For Sange-based items: Multiple sources of slow resistance do not stack
For Sange-based items: Multiple sources of health restoration amplification do not stack
Can be disassembled
Much like Sange and Yasha, this is a cost-effective item that greatly increases a spellcaster's mid-game presence
May be purchased if one wishes to start fighting earlier and establish control

facet_1.name: Masochist
facet_1.effects: Grants Akasha spell amplification bonus with a cost of some of her life blood.

facet_2.name: Bondage
facet_2.effects: Returns a portion of the spell damage she receives back to its source within the radius. Additionally, Spell Lifesteal now also works with both reflected magical damage and reflected pure damage for Akasha.

effects: Shadow Strike now hits all enemy units within the radius.
When the Shadow Strike debuff expires or whenever it is reapplied, the affected enemy unit emits a Scream of Pain of its corresponding level centered around itself.
Releases a sonic boom, deals damage and silences affected enemy units within the radius when Akasha blinks, at both her starting and ending locations.

abilities.name: Succubus
abilities.description: The closer the enemy units, the stronger the Akasha's spell lifesteal for herself is. Spell Lifesteal also works with Pure damage sourced to Akasha.
abilities.details: Stacks additively with other spell lifesteal sources. The spell lifesteal value reduces by 2.4% per 100-distance between Akasha and the affected enemy unit up to the min bonus radius.

abilities.name: Masochist
abilities.description: Grants Akasha spell amplification bonus with a cost of some of her life blood.
abilities.details: The self-damage is non-lethal and deals the same spell damage type as the ability cast. Does not affect illusions.

ability_1.name: Shadow Strike
ability_1.details: Hurls a poisoned dagger that deals first damage to the unit-targeted enemy, then applies damage over time with a movement speed slow.
ability_1.description: Akasha's envenomed dagger allows her to delight in the drawn out suffering of her victims.
technical_details: Can travel a max 2/1.8/1.64/1.5 seconds corresponding to the target's current location
A dagger visibly appears on the debuff-affected enemy unit, visible to everyone
interaction_notes: No longer proc Spell Block sources
No longer proc Spell Reflection sources
The passive Scream of Pain cast by the affected enemy unit(s) do not proc on-cast effects

ability_2.name: Blink
ability_2.details: Short distance teleportation that allows Akasha to move in and out of combat.
ability_2.description: The Secret Queen lives up to her title, making her pain impossible to escape.
technical_details: When point-targeted beyond the min or max distance, Blink teleports Akasha toward the min or max distance respectively
interaction_notes: Multiple overlapping Blink radius stack, enemy units within both the start and end location can be affected twice

ability_3.name: Scream of Pain
ability_3.details: Let loose a piercing scream around Akasha, damaging nearby enemies.
ability_3.description: The sultry voice of Akasha beckons her opponents while stealing their souls.
technical_details: Can travel up to a max 1.5 seconds based on the location within the radius of the affected enemy unit
interaction_notes: Affects Fogged units and Invisible units
Does not affect Hidden units and Invulnerable units

ability_4.name: Sonic Wave
ability_4.details: Creates a gigantic wave of sound in front of Akasha, dealing heavy damage to all enemy units in its wake and pushing them back.
ability_4.description: Her most exquisite of all of torments, Akasha's Sonic Wave puts her poor foes out of their misery.
technical_details: Can affect enemy units at max 1350-distance away with the travel distance and end radius
The wave travels at 900-speed, reaching max distance in 1 seconds
Deals 25/35.71/46.43 pure spell damage in 0.1-second intervals, over 14 damage instances
interaction_notes: Applies a non-disabling fixed 350-distance knockback to all affected units
Can push enemy units over impassable terrain
Trees within a 200-radius centered around all debuff-affected enemy units are destroyed

neutral.name: Book of the Dead
neutral.description: A record of the final reckoning. With one page torn out.

abilities.name: Greater Demonic Summoning
abilities.description: Summons a number of Necronomicon Warriors and Necronomicon Archers that are under the caster's control, with strong attacks and several abilities of their own.
notes: Interrupts the caster's channeling abilities upon cast
The summons always spawn in front of the caster
Recasting Greater Demonic Summoning replaces the summons from the previous cast, no matter under whose control they are
However, recasting it with a second Book of the Dead (stolen from the enemy or copied by a Tempest Double) creates new summons
The summons cannot be targeted by Helm of the Dominator or Helm of the Overlord, and the warrior cannot be targeted by Hand of Midas
However, they can be targeted by other unit converting or instantly killing abilities (e.g. Holy Persuasion or Devour)

additionalInfo: Acquired by crafting with Madstone. See the Madstone article for crafting mechanics.
The summons are granted an attack damage bonus
When crafted with the Dormant Curio, the duration is increased by 30%

enchantment.name: Audacious Enchantment
additionalInfo: The attack damage bonus is magical damage
Acquired by crafting with Madstone. See the Madstone article for crafting mechanics
